results.title: Sex rules
results.brief_description:
Jo and Nik are best friends until they start having to contend with boys and sex. When Jo finds out that her favourite teacher has AIDS, she becomes obsessed with the subject and bases her school artwork on the theme of safe sex. At the same time Nik is becoming involved with a boy and decides to have sex with him without a condom.
Cast features Kirsty McGregor as Jo and Angelica Klages as Nik.

results.title: Sex rules
results.brief_description: Produced with the assistance of the AIDS Bureau of NSW and explores the personal decision making necessary when becoming involved in sexual relationships and the precautions needed to ensure “safe sex” and avoid AIDS. Teacher preview recommended before screening this video.

results.title: Sex mission = Seksmisja [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Polish Corporation for Film Production and Juliusz Machulski
results.brief_description: When Professor Victor Kuppelweiser wishes to test his cryogenic experiments for the first time on human beings he has two willing volunteers. Both scientists, a mis-matched pair Albert Starski and Maximilian Paradys (Jerzy Stuhr, Olgierd Lukaszewicz), are hoping for historical recognition and fame. But the experiment goes wrong and our heroes find themselves awoken (53 years later) by a post-nuclear society containing only women - who hate men. This slapstick comedy rather than implying any feminist critique pokes fun at totalitarianism, ironic in that the first-time director, Juliusz Machulski, made this film using state money in a communist country under martial law. A hilarious film that pokes fun at the values of the day by talking about tomorrow and borrows much of its stylings from films such as “Barbarella”, “The Sleeper” and thematically from films like “1984” and “Fahrenheit 451.”

results.title: Sex and Zen II
results.creator_credit: Golden Movies International, Wong Jing and Chin Man-Kei
results.brief_description: A surreal, offbeat and lush sequel to the original cult classic, this is the farcical story of a man whose lascivious escapades lead to serious trouble. In the process of arranging a liason for his son, the hero becomes involved with the ‘Mirage Woman’, unaware that she is a pursued criminal who extracts the essence of all her sexual partners and kills them. With four wives and the pick of all the women in the country, has he finally met his match? This is a humourous and colourful saga that continues the notoriously explicit style of the original. In Cantonese with english subtitles.

results.title: Sex
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), National AIDS Campaign and John Eastway
results.brief_description: Sex is a program for young people. It deals in a fast, funny and frank way with relationships, sex, sexuality and sexual health in the context of HIV/AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases (STDs). Issues covered include choosing/negotiating not to have any sexual activity at all; choosing not to have penetrative sex; exploring alternative sexual activities; STDs, including HIV, their symptoms, modes of transmission and prevention; using condoms. Written by Morris Gleitzman of “Mother and Son” fame.

results.title: Seward's folly
results.creator_credit: Hill & Anderson Productions and Charles Diltz
results.brief_description: Alaska, a land of vast stretches of snow became a part of the United States in 1867. This is a documentary on the life and times of the people and wildlife of Alaska.

results.title: Sewage solutions (advanced version)
results.creator_credit: Video Education Australia and Geoff Russell
results.brief_description: Deals with the mechanical, chemical and biological processes used to treat human sewage , looking at an inland system (Bendigo) and a marine based system (Geelong).

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Communications, Infrastructure, & Transport → Sewage disposal plants

results.title: Sewage disposal
results.brief_description: The film opens with shots of the waste of a house flowing in the sewer, this sewer being illustrated by a remarkable cross-section of the waste disposal system of a house, and the sewer in the adjacent road. An animated map of London’s vast sewage system is built up historically, shown in relation to relief and drainage and the urban spread of London. Finally a close-up study of the pumping and purification station is shown, and we see the treatment of the seage until unusable sludge is shipped to sea.

results.title: Several days in the life of I.I. Oblomov
results.brief_description:
Oblomov is based on a gently satirical novel by Ivan Goncharov set in the mid-nineteenth century about an absentee landlord who stays in bed because he cannot find a convincing reason for getting up. He has tried getting up in the past but sees no reason to go on with it. Moreover, as a man of means he is in the position of being able to choose not to go on with it. ‘(An) engagingly adapted parable of a privileged recluse being reluctantly dragged towards light, life and love…As the tardily socialised eternally indecisive Oblomov, Tabakov invests sloth with a winning seductiveness’ (Paul Taylor in Time Out). Another print also available on 16mm.

Credits: Director, Nikita Mikhalkov ; script, A. Adabashian, N. Mikhalkov ; photography, Pavel Lebeshev ; music, E. Artemiev.
Cast: Oleg Tabakov, Yuri Bogatyryov, Andrei Popov, Yelena Solovei.
